Posts.Content:
My doctor is a breast specialist and I intend to ask him at my next appt. but I have researched and found some connection to my diagnosis of Stage Zero Microcalcification malignancy to be connected to former injury, operation or infection in that breast. I had my first biopsy about
 11 yrs ago in a hospital with a regular surgeon. It was benign and it was a fatty fibrous lump. However I got a terrible staph infection at the surgery incision site. I had high fever and red streaks and a huge amount if pain and drainage from the incision which was on the nipple so it was extremely painful! I had to go to the surgeon daily to have a needle inserted to drain fluids. The surgeon never billed me at all. I think he felt very bad about
 it but my concern is if that staph infection has resulted in my recent malignancy then do I have recourse???
Posts.Title: Staph infection from Biopsy

Posts.Content: Staph infection from Biopsy!HORRIBLE infection resulting from biopsy on left breast 10 yrs ago. Now 2 additional biopsies later I have Stage 0 Microcalcification Cancer. After doing research I have found that there is some connection to this type cancer and prior breast infections. Anyone else have this? Is that infection caused from a bad biopsy to blame for what I'm facing now?
Posts.Title: Staph infection from Biopsy

Posts.Content: I'm just trying to see if there is a connection to the two. In my mind I want to know how or why I am dealing with this. If I could figure out the how/ why it would help me with my anxiety. I also know that in many cases there is no answer and it just happens. I'm just trying to see if I have stumbled onto a why?
